page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: {Land}- Well wooded undulating plateau of flinty clay at top with south slopes of chalk in the centre and very flinty loam along the base. {Village}Privett centred about Church and School, Bailey Green part of Privett area includes village hall. {Church}of the Holy Trinity.Spire 160ft. Redundant Church. {Housing}Mainly farmhouses and cottages. Some 75% are occupied by people who work outside the area or have retired. {Inns}Pig and Whistle (small brewery) West Meon Hut (restaurant) {Roads}A272 Winchester to Petersfield runs east/west along the base. A32 Alton to Fareham runs north-east /south-west through the centre. There are many lanes to connect scattered farms and houses.
